text:

Note: Some datasets require access approval before downloading.




Raw data is stored on HPC in /scratch/user/data/

Processed results are in /scratch/user/analysis/

If you need access to specific datasets, contact the analysis team.

title: Bioinformatics Analysis Overview
text:
1 Overview of Analyses
Below is a summary of completed analyses:



Analysis
Description
Results




GWAS QC
Quality control of genome-wide association study data
View


PRS Calculation
Polygenic risk score calculation for Alzheimer‚Äôs risk
View


Differential Expression
Transcriptomic analysis of case vs.¬†control samples
View



This site is updated regularly as new analyses are completed.



2 Data Catalogue
A list of datasets used in these analyses can be found here.

title: Analysis Title
text: Provide a brief description of the analysis, its objectives, and key findings.

title: Analysis Title
text:
Methods

Data Sources

Dataset: dataset_name
Location: /path/to/data/
Number of Samples: XXX



Analysis Steps

Load the dataset
Perform QC and filtering
Generate visualizations
Summarize key findings

title: Analysis Title
text:
Results

1Ô∏è‚É£ Interactive Table of Summary Statistics


Code
library(DT)

# Dummy data
df <- data.frame(
  Sample = paste0("Sample_", 1:10),
  SNPs = sample(500000:1000000, 10),
  MissingRate = runif(10, 0, 0.05),
  Heterozygosity = runif(10, 0.3, 0.5)
)

datatable(df, options = list(pageLength = 5, scrollX = TRUE))








1Ô∏è‚É£ Interactive PCA Plot


Code
library(plotly)


Loading required package: ggplot2



Attaching package: 'plotly'


The following object is masked from 'package:ggplot2':

    last_plot


The following object is masked from 'package:stats':

    filter


The following object is masked from 'package:graphics':

    layout


Code
# Dummy PCA data
set.seed(123)
pca_data <- data.frame(
  Sample = paste0("Sample_", 1:50),
  PC1 = rnorm(50),
  PC2 = rnorm(50),
  Population = sample(c("Group A", "Group B"), 50, replace = TRUE)
)

p <- plot_ly(pca_data, x = ~PC1, y = ~PC2, color = ~Population, type = 'scatter', mode = 'markers', text = ~Sample)
p


Warning in RColorBrewer::brewer.pal(N, "Set2"): minimal value for n is 3, returning requested palette with 3 different levels
Warning in RColorBrewer::brewer.pal(N, "Set2"): minimal value for n is 3, returning requested palette with 3 different levels








Interpretation
Summarize key findings, trends, and next steps.


Download & Reproducibility
Full script: Download Raw data: /path/to/results/ Re-run instructions:



üîπ How to Use This Template

Save it as analysis_template.qmd in your analysis/ folder.

Copy and rename it for each new analysis (e.g., gwas_qc.qmd, prs.qmd).

Modify the title, categories, and content.

Update the data and plots dynamically based on new analyses.




Next Steps

Let me know how to refine this further! üöÄ

title: Analysis Title
text:
3 Results

3.1 1Ô∏è‚É£ Interactive Table of Summary Statistics


Code
library(DT)

# Dummy data
df <- data.frame(
  Sample = paste0("Sample_", 1:10),
  SNPs = sample(500000:1000000, 10),
  MissingRate = runif(10, 0, 0.05),
  Heterozygosity = runif(10, 0.3, 0.5)
)

datatable(df, options = list(pageLength = 5, scrollX = TRUE))








3.2 1Ô∏è‚É£ Interactive PCA Plot


Code

  Sample = paste0("Sample_", 1:50),

  PC2 = rnorm(50),
